results.title: Night train [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Tristan Orpen Lynch, Subotica Films, Coachouse Productions and John Lynch
results.brief_description: Night train is a romantic drama by first time director John Lynch featuring Oscar nominees John Hurt (Elephant Man, 1984) as Michael Poole, an ex-con man, and Brenda Blethyn (Secrets and Lies, Saving Grace) as Alice, the landlady’s daughter. Upon release from prison, Michael Poole seeks refuge in an effort to avoid pursuit by a sinister gangland boss to whom he owes money. He moves into a house owned by an elderly domineering mother (Pauline Flanagan) and her emotionally repressed daughter, Alice. Poole finds his passion for electric model trains has Alice intrigued and together they find escape in his strange fantasy world. An awkward and tender romance begins to develop between these two rather sad and lonely people, frustrated by their pasts, and determined to find happiness in their future. But Poole is forced to take flight as the mob boss closes in, and with him Alice, on a real night train adventure on the Orient Express. Set in Dublin and filmed on location in Ireland, England and Italy, “Night train” has many delightful and touching moments performed by two great actors and a very capable supporting cast. Cast also includes Lorcan Cranitch, Cathy White, Peter Caffrey, Paul Roe and Rynagh O’Grady. (Awards: Winner Silver Rose Best Actor John Hurt, Schermi d’Amore Verona; Nominated Best European Film John Lynch, Brussels International Film Festival)

results.title: Night people's day
results.brief_description: Explores the city at night with emphasis on people who work at night and their occupations. The soundtrack recreates, with human voices and sound effects, the variety of sounds of the city and its activities. Night people tell why they prefer to work at night. Photography by Bob Hillman. Vocal sound effects by Bob Kurtz and Glenn Johnson.

results.title: Night Out
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School, Lisa Doherty and Lawrence Johnston
results.brief_description: A young man is savagely bashed when he visits a toilet beat for sex. The assault forces a reassessment of the relationship he has with his boyfriend, as well as resulting in a self-examination of his own needs and desires. “Night out” is an intense Australian short that is as much about the intricacies and uncertainties of contemporary sexual relationships as it is about the violation and humiliation of physical assault. Official entry in the “Un Certain Regard” section of the 1990 Cannes Film Festival.

results.title: Night on Bald Mountain = Nuit sur le Mont Chauve
results.brief_description: A significant early animation from the silent/sound transition period, this fantasy is based on Mussorgsky’s tone (symphonic) poem, evoking a world of demons, witches and goblins. The first film by the Parisian lithographer, Alexander Alexeieff (made with the assistance of his wife Claire Parker) using his famous pinboard invention which allowed production of a great range of tonal qualities.

results.title: Night of the living dead (Special 30th anniversary ed.)
results.creator_credit: Image Ten, Russell W Streiner, Karl Hardman and George A. Romero
results.brief_description: A group of escapees from a growing army of flesh-eating zombies spreading across the countryside take refuge in a house. With EC horror comics of the fifties as an acknowledged influence, this film, at times technically rough, was produced independently on a low budget. It has become a horror/science fiction classic, which, like “The Birds”, can be placed in the Armageddon sub-genre: the world threatened with extinction. It is also one of the earliest horror films to defy all generic conventions, with it’s down-beat ending and its unconventional choice of an African-American man as the heroic lead. With “Night of the living dead” director George A. Romero and writer John A. Russo offered terror to audiences, without the assurance that it was an otherworldly threat, the danger now lay from within the bland suburban confines. The film’s surprise box office success in America and its growing cult popularity around the world tapped into a generation that was witnessing the real horror of the Vietnam war and the mounting cynicism about the ethics of the government of the time. Romero went on to direct two self-contained sequels (Dawn of the dead and Day of the dead), creating an unforgettable horror trilogy, still considered as classics of the genre. Note: this edition of “Night of the living dead” contains the 30th anniversary version which was recut (new filmed footage was also added), by writer and producer John A. Russo without director George A. Romero’s input and is considered by fans of the genre as inferior to the original which also appears on this DVD. Cast includes Duane Jones, Judith O’Dea, Karl Hardman and Marilyn Eastman.

results.title: Night of the execution. Forty detectives later
results.creator_credit: Shamley Productions and Alfred J Hitchcock Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Alfred Hitchcock presents”.
Two more twisted fables hosted by the master of the macabre. “Night of the execution”: A District Attorney, keen for political success and whose wife is more ambtious than he is, is desperate for a conviction in a murder trial he is prosecuting. So desperate, he is willing to do anything to send the defendant to the chair… anything. “Forty detectives later”: A man who claims he has found his wife’s murderer, hires his forty-first detective to wreak vengeance…

results.title: Night light
results.brief_description: A video clip made up of a series of photo stills taken of night lights. Images and the resonant, original soundtrack capture the intensity and variety of urban life.

results.title: Night flight
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Malcolm Patterson
results.brief_description: A rare insight into the life of the sugar glider, one of Australia’s unique nocturnal marsupials. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Night driving
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall, John Edwards and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “How to Drive”.
If your vision is normal and the lighting equipment of your car is in efficient working order, there is nothing to be scared of in night driving. The same section of road from a driver’s viewpoint is shown by day and by night, pointing out the different methods of detecting various features which will affect course and speed in night driving.
